Course_Name: [SoSe 2024] Student Research Project: Experimental and Behavioral Economics

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Change of room tomorrow (July 8) at WZB!

Messages.Author: Dorothea Kübler
Messages.Content: Dear all,  The student presentations as well as the lecture on Monday July 8 will take place at the WZB in room B002/003 (which is the same room as in the past weeks). Originally, I announced a different room but this is no longer valid. See you tomorrow and all the best, Dorothea

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Important! No lecture on June 17 and assignment

Messages.Author: Dorothea Kübler
Messages.Content: Dear all,  I would like to inform you about three things.  1. There will be no lecture on June 17 (and no student presentations). 2. Instead please take a few minutes to fill in the evaluation form: https://befragung.tu-berlin.de/evasys/online.php?pswd=5EQE9. This is really important to us! So please give us your thoughts and opininions. 3. The lecture and student presentations on June 24 will take place at the WZB again, in room B001. Thus, there will be two sessions on that day, one from 10.15 to 11.45 for the presentations and one from 12.15 to 1.45 pm. Everybody should attend the presentations if possible. All the best and see you on June 24! Dorothea

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Room change for June 10, June 24, July 1, and July 8

Messages.Author: Dorothea Kübler
Messages.Content: Dear all, Since it was impossible to get a room for our presentations on Monday mornings from 10 to 12 at TU Berlin, we will now do both the presentations and the lecture at the WZB, Reichpietschufer 50. We have booked the following rooms from 10 am to 2 pm: June 10: B002/003 June 24: B001  July 1: B002/003 July 8: A305 Please let us know if you cannot make it until 10.15 am or have to leave before 1.45 pm because of the change in location.  All the best, Dorothea

Messages.Author: Dorothea Kübler
Messages.Content: Dear participants, Here are a few guidelines to help you for preparing the presentations: Each research team gives a presentation on •       Their research question and why it is interesting/relevant •       A very short summary of the related literature •       Their experimental design, including their treatment variation •       The variables that they intend to measure and the question wording •       Their hypotheses and how they will test them •       During and after the presentations, the whole group may ask questions and make suggestions to help the teams improve their planned study •       Presentations, including discussion, should take no more than 25 minutes, so plan for presentations of 15 minutes to leave enough time for discussion.  All the best, Dorothea, Hande and Mira

Messages.Author: Dorothea Kübler
Messages.Content: Dear all, You can now register via MTS for this course. Please do so until May 22, 2024! Only non-TU students do not have to register. Thank you! Dorothea

Messages.Author: Dorothea Kübler
Messages.Content: The first lecture will take place on Monday, April, 15, at 12.15 pm in room BH-N333. There is no class from 10 to 12 in this week. No registration is necessary at this point.
